item.title: Inouye Ceremony | CQ Roll Call
item.description: Bob and Elizabeth Dole pay respects to Sen. Inouye http://t.co/R9zGfAfs
item.content:encoded: Bob and Elizabeth Dole pay respects to Sen. Inouye http://t.co/R9zGfAfs UNITED STATES - DECEMBER 20: Former Sen. Bob Dole, R-Kan., salutes the casket of the late Sen. Daniel Inouye, D-Hawaii, as his body lies in state in the Capitol rotunda, as Dole's wife, former Sen. Elizabeth Dole, R-N.C., looks on. Bob Dole and Inouye knew each other since they were recovering from World War II battle wounds. Dole was assisted to the casket saying "I wouldn't want Danny to see me in a wheelchair." (Photo By Tom Williams/CQ Roll Call) Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: photoshelter.com

item.content:encoded: My post on Charlotte Allen and the whole ugly post Newtown conversation. http://t.co/OGMXVIOy Jonah Goldberg writes on NRO: I haven’t written much about the Newtown shooting. I did write my first column of the week about it because I felt I had to chime in. But I resented it. Maybe it’s because I’m becoming too sentimental about kids. item.content:encoded: Emotional Viral Video Looks Back at 'What Brought Us Together' in 2012 http://t.co/EwTIetYc A tear-jerker of a viral video, called "2012: What Brought Us Together," is making the rounds online. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Why the entertainment industry's release strategy creates piracy
item.description: Why the entertainment industry's release strategy creates piracy: If companies refuse to release films or TV shows… http://t.co/kY6s9P8P
item.content:encoded: Why the entertainment industry's release strategy creates piracy: If companies refuse to release films or TV shows… http://t.co/kY6s9P8P Cory Doctorow: If companies refuse to release films or TV shows in US and UK at same time, they only have themselves to blame for piracy Link - Trackbacks
